data.title: "Relaxing and fun time with the family"
data.text: Spent a couple of hour at the Rotary Riverwalk Park last weekend with my husband and teenage boys.  It was a place to feel like a kid age and swing by the river.

data.title: Fishing Rod Swing!
data.text: Great "fishing rod" swing and photo scenes.   This is connected to a great walking bridge where you can see the dam, Capitol, and Asian gardens.  You can visit these three in one stop!

data.title: Interesting park beside the Des Moines River
data.text: Interesting park beside the Des Moines River, near a bridge in commemoration of the achievements of women. Very interesting recreation of a fishing pole with his float, and games for children

data.title: Take the time to stop
data.text: Beautiful view of the river dams and the city. Cute little swung area with handicap accessible swing and rubberized ground. My 2 1/2 yo granddaughter loved it.

data.title: Nice stop along the Riverwalk
data.text: This new park is located on the riverwalk, right on the west side of the pedestrian bridge downtown. It's easy to see the Asian Gardens on the east side of the pedestrian bridge, cross over the river, and play at Rotary Riverwalk Park. All together, it makes a nice scenic stop.
